DataElement.preferredName: Auditory Brain Stem Response Assessment Performed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not an ABR (Auditory Brainstem Response) was performed. This is a test an audiologist can perform which measures the brain's response to sound. It uses electrodes placed in strategic locations on the head to determine how well the acoustic nerve transmits the signal representing sound from the cochlea to the brain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Auditory Brain Stem Response Assessment Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the process of hearing._The part of the brain that connects the cerebral hemispheres with the spinal cord. It consists of the mesencephalon, pons, and medulla oblongata._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the process of hearing.:The part of the brain that connects the cerebral hemispheres with the spinal cord. It consists of the mesencephalon, pons, and medulla oblongata.:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the process of hearing.

Three sections, the midbrain, pons and medulla oblongata, that are located at the base of the brain. The brain stem regulates the central nervous system, and is vital as a conduit for motor and sensory innervations.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
